article.title: Drew_Barrymore

template.arg: Barrymore at the ''[[Blended (film)|Blended]]'' Berlin premiere, May 2014

article.paragraph: Drew Blythe Barrymore(born February 22, 1975)cite webhttp://www.filmreference.com/film/99/Drew-Barrymore.htmlDrew Barrymore Biography (1975-)FilmReference.com2014-04-22is an American actress, author, director, modeler and producer. She is a descendant of theBarrymore familyof well-known American stage and cinema actors, and is a granddaughter of film actorJohn Barrymore. Barrymore first appeared in an advertisement when she was eleven months old. In 1980, she made her film debut inAltered States. In 1982, she starred in her breakout role as Gertie inSteven Spielberg'sE.T. the Extra-Terrestrialand quickly became one of Hollywood's most recognized child actresses, going on to establish herself in mainlyComedic filmcomicroles.

Following a turbulent childhood which was marked by recurringDrug abusedrugandalcohol abuse, and two stints inDrug rehabilitationrehab,Barrymore wrote the 1990 autobiography,Little Girl Lost. She successfully made the transition from child star to adult actress with a number of films includingPoison Ivy (1992 film)Poison Ivy,Bad Girls (1994 film)Bad Girls,Boys on the SideandEveryone Says I Love You. Subsequently, she also starred inromantic comedy filmromantic comedies, such asThe Wedding Singerand50 First Dates.

In 1997, she and her business partnerNancy Juvonenformed the production companyFlower Films,cite webhttp://www.miss-barrymore.com/drew-barrymore/biography/Miss BarrymoreMiss BarrymoreAugust 9, 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20130607134234/http://www.miss-barrymore.com/drew-barrymore/biography/7 June 2013yeswith its first production the 1999 Barrymore filmNever Been Kissed. Flower Films went on to produce the Barrymore vehicle filmsCharlie's Angels (film)Charlie's Angels,50 First DatesandMusic and Lyrics, as well as the cult filmDonnie Darko. Barrymore's more recent projects includeHe's Just Not That Into You (film)He's Just Not That Into You,Beverly Hills Chihuahua,Everybody's Fine (2009 film)Everybody's FineandGoing the Distance (2010 film)Going the Distance. A recipient of a star on theHollywood Walk of Fame, Barrymore appeared on the cover of the 2007People (American magazine)Peoplemagazine's 100 Most Beautiful issue.

Barrymore was named an Ambassador Against Hunger for the UNWorld Food Programme(WFP). Since then, she has donated over US$1 million to the program. In 2007, she became bothCoverGirl's newest model and spokeswoman for the cosmetic and the face forGucci's newest jewelry line. In 2010, she won theScreen Actors Guild Awardand theGolden Globe Award for Best Actress Miniseries or Television FilmGolden Globe Award for Best Actress in a Miniseries or Television Filmfor her portrayal ofLittle EdieinGrey Gardens (2009 film)Grey Gardens.
article.heading: Early life and family
article.paragraph: Barrymore was born inCulver City, California, to American actorJohn Drew Barrymore(1932-2004) and Jaid Barrymore (born Ildik Jaid Mak),cite newsActor John D. Barrymore dies at 72http://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2004-11-29-barrymore-obit_x.htmSeptember 7, 2008November 29, 2004USA Todayan aspiring actress. Barrymore's mother was born in adisplaced persons campinBrannenburg,West Germany, toHungaryHungarianWorld War IIrefugees.citation neededJuly 2015Her parents divorced in 1984, when she was nine years old.She is one of four children with a half-brother, John,cite newsActor Barrymore attacked at homehttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/1970567.stmSeptember 7, 2008May 6, 2002BBCLondonwho is also an actor, and two half-sisters, Blyth and Jessica.citation neededJuly 2015

Barrymore was born into acting: all of her paternal great-grandparents -Maurice BarrymoreandGeorgiana DrewGeorgie Drew Barrymore, andMaurice CostelloandMae Costello(neAltschuk)Stein Hoffman, Carol.The Barrymores: Hollywood's First Family. University Press of Kentucky, 2001. ISBN 0-8131-2213-9.- as well as her paternal grandparents,John BarrymoreandDolores Costello, were actors;John Barrymore was arguably the most acclaimed actor of his generation.She is the niece ofDiana Barrymoreand the grandniece ofLionel Barrymore,Ethel BarrymoreandHelene Costello,"The Costello Family."BarrymoreFamily.com.the great-great-granddaughter of Irish-bornJohn Drew (actor)John Drewand English-bornLouisa Lane Drew, all of whom were actors, and the great-grandniece of Broadway idolJohn Drew, Jr.and silent film actor, writer and directorMr. & Mrs. Sidney DrewSidney Drew."The Drew family."BarrymoreFamily.com.She is also the god-daughter of directorSteven Spielberg,cite webTrachtaAlihttp://blogs.laweekly.com/squidink/2012/04/drew_barrymore_wine.phpQ & A With Drew Barrymore: L.A. Cravings, Dying Art Forms & Barrymore Wines â€“ Los Angeles â€“ Restaurants and Dining â€“ Squid InkBlogs.laweekly.comApril 17, 2012January 27, 2013cite webhttp://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/drew-barrymore-admits-to-suffering-freak-245166Drew Barrymore admits to suffering "freak outs" over her long distance relationship with Justin Long â€“ Mirror OnlineMirror.co.ukSeptember 2, 2010January 27, 2013cite webhttp://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hollywood/news-interviews/Drew-Barrymore-seeks-advice-from-godfather-Spielberg/articleshow/18207142.cmsDrew Barrymore seeks advice from 'godfather' Spielberg â€“ The Times of IndiaTimesofindia.indiatimes.comJanuary 27, 2013https://web.archive.org/web/20130128073148/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hollywood/news-interviews/Drew-Barrymore-seeks-advice-from-godfather-Spielberg/articleshow/18207142.cms?January 28, 2013yesand actressSophia Loren.cite newsBaby Bootyhttp://women.timesonline.co.uk/tol/life_and_style/women/families/article2941547.eceMarch 23, 2009December 2, 2007The Sunday TimesUKSpencerJamescite webhttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/7919486/Drew-Barrymore-interview.htmlDrew Barrymore interviewTelegraphJanuary 27, 2013

Her first name, "Drew", was the maiden name of her paternal great-grandmother, Georgie Drew Barrymore, and her middle name, "Blythe", was the original surname of the dynasty founded by her great-grandfather, Maurice Barrymore.
article.heading: Career
Early career
article.paragraph: File:President Reagan with Drew Barrymore at a ceremony launching the Young Astronauts program on the south lawn. October 17, 1984.jpgthumbuprightBarrymore with PresidentRonald ReaganReagan, October 17, 1984Barrymore's career began when she was auditioned for a dog food commercial when she was 11 months old.When she was bitten by her canine co-star, the producers were afraid she would cry, but she merely laughed, and was hired for the job.She made her feature film debut inAltered States(1980), in which she had a small part.A year later, she played Gertie, the younger sister of Elliott, inE.T. the Extra-Terrestrial, which made her one of the most famous child stars of the time and earned her theYoung Artist Awardas4th Youth in Film Awards#Best Young Performer in a Feature FilmBest Young Supporting Actress in a Motion Picturein 1982.cite webhttp://www.youngartistawards.org/pastnoms4.htm4th Annual Youth in Film AwardsMarch 31, 2011YoungArtistAwards.orgShe received aGolden Globenomination asGolden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actress  Motion PictureBest Supporting Actress in a Motion Picturein 1984 for her role inIrreconcilable Differences, in which she starred as a young girl divorcing her parents.cite webHFPA â€“ Awards Searchhttp://www.goldenglobes.org/browse/member/28761July 3, 2008Golden GlobesIn a review in theChicago Sun-Times,Roger Ebertstated: "Barrymore is the right actress for this role precisely because she approaches it with such grave calm."cite webRogerEberthttp://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AIDIrreconciable Differences film reviewJuly 15, 2008January 1, 1984Roger Ebert.comChicago Sun-Times
article.heading: Rebellious era
article.paragraph: In the wake of this sudden stardom, Barrymore endured a notoriously troubled childhood. She was already a regular at the famedStudio 54when she was a little girl, smoking cigarettes at the age of nine, drinking alcohol by the time she was eleven, smokingcannabis (drug)marijuanaat the age of twelve and snortingcocaineat the age of thirteen.Her nightlife and constant partying became a popular subject with the media.She was in rehab at the age of fourteen,where she spent eighteen months in an institution for the mentally ill.cite webhttp://www.theguardian.com/culture/2015/oct/25/drew-barrymore-mother-locked-up-in-institution-interviewDrew Barrymore: â€˜My mother locked me up in an institution at 13. Boo hoo! I needed itâ€™SimonHattenstonetheguardian.com2015-10-2525 October 2015A suicide attempt, also at the age of fourteen, put her back in rehab, followed by a three-month stay with singerDavid Crosbyand his wife.The stay was precipitated, Crosby said, because she "needed to be around some people that were committed to sobriety."Barrymore later described this period of her life in her autobiography,Little Girl Lost.The following year, following a successful juvenile court petition forEmancipation of minorsemancipation, she moved into her own apartment.

File:Drew Barrymore Corey Feldman (cropped).jpgthumbleftBarrymore withCorey Feldmanat the 61st Academy Awards, March 29, 1989In her late teens, her rebelliousness played itself out on screen and in print. Barrymore forged an image as a manipulative teenage seductress, beginning with the filmPoison Ivy (1992 film)Poison Ivy(1992), which was a box office failure, but was popular on video andCable televisioncable.cite webOwenGleibermanhttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,310405,00.htmlPoison Ivy ReviewJuly 25, 2008May 8, 1992Entertainment WeeklyThat same year, at the age of seventeen, she posed nude for the cover of the July issue ofInterview (magazine)Interviewmagazine with her then-fianc, actorJamie Walters (American entertainer)Jamie Walters, as well as appearing nude in pictures inside the issue.cite journalBronwenHruskaSummer Sneaks Drew, We Hardly Knew Ye The littlest Barrymore finally seems back on track in solid film roles. Though she's already lived several lives, her future looks bright. After all, she's only 20.May 14, 1999Los Angeles Times5In 1992, she underwent breast reduction surgery and has said on the subject:

paragraph.template: quote<arg name=""I really love my body and the way it is right now. There's something very awkward about women and their breasts because men look at them so much. When they're huge, you become very self-conscious. Your back hurts. You find that whatever you wear, you look heavy in. It's uncomfortable. I've learned something, though, about breasts through my years of pondering and pontificating, and that is: Men love them, and I love that."{{cite web | first">Nancy | last

article.paragraph: In 1993, Barrymore earned a secondGolden Globenomination, this time for the filmGuncrazy.Barrymore posed nude at the age of nineteen for the January 1995 issue ofPlayboy.cite newsBelindaLuscombehttp://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,983508,00.htmlMs. Barrymore, Super GroupieJuly 20, 2008October 2, 1995TIMEcite newsChristopher JohnFarleyhttp://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,982738,00.htmlLow Voltage, High PowerJuly 20, 2008March 27, 1995TIMESteven Spielberg, who directed her inE.T. the Extra-Terrestrialwhen she was a child and is her godfather, gave her aquiltfor her twentieth birthday with a note that read, "Cover yourself up."Enclosed were copies of herPlayboypictures, with the pictures altered by his art department so that she appeared fully clothed.cite episode[[E! True Hollywood Story]]Drew Barrymore[[E!]]November 28, 2007During a 1995 appearance onLate Show with David Letterman, Barrymore climbed ontoDavid Letterman's desk and bared her breasts to him, her back to the camera, in celebration of his birthday.She modeled in a series ofGuess (clothing)Guess?jeans ads during this time.cite newsAmy M.Spindlerhttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resTrash FashJuly 3, 2008September 12, 1993[[The New York Times|New York Times]]
article.heading: Return to prominence
article.paragraph: In 1995, Barrymore starred inBoys on the SideoppositeWhoopi GoldbergandMary-Louise Parker,cite newsBrianLowryBoys on the Sidehttp://www.variety.com/review/VE1117903615.html?categoryidJuly 25, 2008January 23, 1995Varietyand in hercameo appearanceinJoel Schumacher's filmBatman Forever, she played Sugar, a moll toTwo-Face(Tommy Lee Jones).cite webPeterTraversBatman Foreverhttp://www.rollingstone.com/reviews/movie/5948895/review/5948896/batman_foreverSeptember 7, 2008December 8, 2000Rolling Stonehttp://web.archive.org/web/20080708013413/http://www.rollingstone.com/reviews/movie/5948895/review/5948896/batman_forever8 July 2008yescite video2005[[Batman Forever]]DVD[[Warner Bros.]]The following year, she made a cameo in the successfulhorror filmScream (1996 film)Scream. Barrymore has continued to be highlybankable starbankable, and a top box office draw.cite webAlmarHaflidasonScreamhttp://www.bbc.co.uk/films/2001/05/24/scream_1996_review.shtmlSeptember 7, 2008May 24, 2001BBCShe was frequently cast inromantic comedy filmromantic comediessuch asWishful Thinking (1997 film)Wishful Thinking(1997),The Wedding Singer(1998),cite newsBenBrantleyThe Wedding Singerhttp://movies.nytimes.com/2006/04/28/theater/reviews/28wedd.htmlSeptember 7, 2008April 28, 2006New York TimesandHome Fries (film)Home Fries(1998).cite newsGlennLovellHome Frieshttp://www.variety.com/review/VE1117477880.html?categoryidJuly 25, 2008September 21, 1998VarietyBarrymore's role in the costume dramaEver After(1998) offered a modern take on the classic fairy tale ofCinderellaand served as a reminder, according to Roger Ebert, of how well Drew Barrymore "can hold the screen and involve us in her characters."cite newsRogerEbertReviews: Ever Afterhttp://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AIDJuly 31, 1998Chicago Sun-TimesFebruary 20, 2011

In 2000, Barrymore was nominated for anEmmy Awardcite webhttp://www.emmys.com/celebrities/drew-barrymoreDrew Barrymore Emmy Award WinnerEmmys.comJanuary 27, 2013for her performance inOlive, the Other Reindeer.citation neededJuly 2015Besides a number of appearances in films produced by her company,Flower Films, includingCharlie's Angels (film)Charlie's Angels, Barrymore had a dramatic role in the comedy-dramaRiding in Cars with Boys(2001), playing a teenage mother in a failed marriage with the drug-addicted father (based on the real-life story ofBeverly Donofrio).In 2002, Barrymore appeared inConfessions of a Dangerous Mind, alongsideSam RockwellandJulia Roberts.cite webPeterTraversConfessions of a Dangerous Mindhttp://www.rollingstone.com/reviews/movie/5947743/review/5947744/confessions_of_a_dangerous_mindSeptember 7, 2008January 16, 2003Rolling Stonehttp://web.archive.org/web/20081203112415/http://www.rollingstone.com/reviews/movie/5947743/review/5947744/confessions_of_a_dangerous_mind3 December 2008yes
article.heading: Flower Films and later work
article.paragraph: File:Drew Barrymore 2 by David Shankbone cropped 2.jpgthumbleftuprightBarrymore at the 2007 ''Tribeca Film Festival''In 1995, Barrymore formedFlower Films, a production company, with business partnerNancy Juvonen.cite webBorysKitFlower grows into Warner Bros. pacthttp://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/search/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_idOctober 12, 2008April 6, 2005Roger Ebert.comhttp://web.archive.org/web/20081216135452/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/search/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id16 December 2008yesThe first film produced by the company was 1999'sNever Been Kissed.cite webRogerEberthttp://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AIDNever Been Kissed ReviewJuly 25, 2008April 9, 1999Roger Ebert.comChicago Sun-TimesThe second offering from the company wasCharlie's Angels (film)Charlie's Angels(2000), a major box office success that helped solidify the standing of both Barrymore and the company.When the production ofRichard Kelly (director)Richard Kelly'sdebut film,Donnie Darko, was threatened, Barrymore stepped forward with financing from Flower Films and took the small role of Karen Pomeroy, the title character's English teacher.cite newsMikeSnider'Darko' takes a long, strange triphttp://www.usatoday.com/life/movies/news/2005-02-14-dvd-donnie-darko_x.htmUSA TodayOctober 12, 2008February 14, 2005Although the film was less than successful at the box office in the wake of9/11, it reachedcult filmstatus after the DVD release, inspiring numerous websites devoted to unraveling the plot twists and meanings.

In 2003, she reprised her role as Dylan Sanders inCharlie's Angels: Full Throttle,and appeared withBen StillerinDuplex (film)Duplexin 2003. Flower Films produced50 First Dateswith co-starAdam Sandler'sHappy Madisoncompany in 2004.cite webNevPiercehttp://www.bbc.co.uk/films/2004/04/05/50_first_dates_2004_review.shtml50 First DatesSeptember 7, 2008April 5, 2004BBCcite newsDrew Barrymore hits milestone of 30http://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2005-04-04-drew-barrymore-birthday_x.htmSeptember 7, 2008April 4, 2005USA TodaySumming up Barrymore's appeal,Roger Ebert, in his review of50 First Dates, described Barrymore as having a "smiling, coy sincerity," describing the film as "ingratiating and lovable."cite webRogerEbertReview: ''50 First Dates''http://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AIDSeptember 7, 2008February 13, 2004Roger Ebert.com50 First Dateswas followed byFever Pitch (2005 film)Fever Pitch(2005), and in 2007,Music and LyricsandLucky You (film)Lucky You.cite webLisaSchwarzbaumhttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20011785,00.htmlMusic and LyricsSeptember 7, 2008February 13, 2007Entertainment Weeklycite newsBrianLowryhttp://www.variety.com/review/VE1117933515.html?categoryidLucky YouSeptember 7, 2008May 2, 2007VarietyShe also starred in recent films, such asBeverly Hills Chihuahua,He's Just Not That Into You (film)He's Just Not That Into You,Grey Gardens (2009 film)Grey GardensandEverybody's Fine (2009 film)Everybody's Fine. Barrymore's directorial debut filmWhip It (film)Whip It, was released in October 2009. It starredEllen PageandMarcia Gay Harden, and centered on an obsession withbeauty pageantsand theAustin, Texas, Hurl Scoutsroller derbyteam. Barrymore also co-starred in the film.cite newsVessLauraRoller Girl Fantasies in Drew Barrymore's 'Whip It'http://www.shewired.com/Article.cfm?IDSheWired.comJuly 17, 2009July 17, 2009

In 2010, Barrymore reunited with former partnerJustin Longon the set ofGoing the Distance (2010 film)Going the Distance, directed byNanette Burstein. AnR-ratedromantic comedy about a couple dealing the ups and downs of along-distance relationshipwhile commuting between New York City and San Francisco, the largely improvised film garnered generally mixed reviews by critics,cite webNellMinowhttp://blog.beliefnet.com/moviemom/2010/09/interview-nanette-burstein-of.htmlInterview: Nanette Burstein of 'Going the Distance'Beliefnet.comSeptember 10, 2010September 23, 2011who summed it as "timelier and a little more honest than most romantic comedies."cite webhttp://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/10012042-going_the_distance/Going the Distance: Movie Reviews, Pictures[[Rotten Tomatoes]][[Flixster]]September 4, 2010Budgeted at US$32 million,cite newshttp://latimesblogs.latimes.com/entertainmentnewsbuzz/2010/09/movie-projector-machete-going-the-distance-and-the-american-go-head-to-head-to-head.htmlMovie projector: 'Machete,' 'Going the Distance' and 'The American' go head-to-head-to-headFritzBen[[Los Angeles Times]][[Tribune Company]]September 2, 2010September 2, 2010the film became a moderate financial success at a worldwide box office total of US$40 million.cite webhttp://www.the-numbers.com/people/DBARR.php''Going the Distance'' (2010)The-Numbers.comSeptember 23, 2011

In 2011, Barrymore starred withJohn KrasinskiinKen Kwapis'sBig Miracle(2012), a romantic drama based on the 1989 bookFreeing the Whales, which coversOperation Breakthrough, the 1988 international effort to rescuegray whalesfrom being trapped in ice nearPoint Barrow, Alaska.cite webhttp://nymag.com/daily/entertainment/2011/09/big_miracle_trailer.html''Big Miracle'' Trailer: Drew Barrymore and John Krasinski Save the WhalesNYMag.com[[New York Magazine]]September 22, 2010September 23, 2011On August 2, 2011, Barrymore directed the music video for the song "Our Deal," for the bandBest Coast, which featuresChlo Grace Moretz,Miranda Cosgrove,Tyler Posey,Donald Glover,Shailene WoodleyandAlia Shawkat.cite web8/2/11http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1668301/best-coast-our-deal-supervideo.jhtmlBest Coast's 'Our Deal' Supervideo: Best Side Story â€“ Music, Celebrity, Artist NewsMTVAugust 2, 2011February 28, 2012
article.heading: Other career highlights
article.paragraph: In 1999, Barrymore was honored by theYoung Artist AwardYoung Artist Foundationwith itsYoung Artist Former Child Star Lifetime Achievement AwardFormer Child Star "Lifetime Achievement" Awardcommemorating her outstanding achievements within thefilm industryas a child actress.cite webhttp://www.youngartistawards.org/pastnoms20.htm20th Annual Youth in Film AwardsMarch 31, 2011YoungArtistAwards.orgIn 2005, she began a recurring role in the animated comedyFamily GuyasBrian Griffin's simple-minded girlfriend, Jillian.cite episodeWhistle While Your Wife WorksFamily GuySteve Callaghan and Greg ColtonFoxNovember 12, 200655She subsequently appeared in a total of eleven episodes.cite episodePrick Up Your EarsFamily GuyCherry Chevapravatdumrong and James PurdumFoxNovember 19, 200656cite episodeChick CancerFamily GuyAlec Sulkin, Wellesley Wild, and Pete MichelsFoxNovember 26, 200657cite episodeBarely LegalFamily GuyKirker Butler and Zac MoncriefFoxDecember 17, 200658She was the subject of the 2005 documentaryMy Date with Drew.In it, an aspiring filmmaker, who was a fan of Barrymore's, used his limited resources in an attempt to gain a date with her.cite webOwenGleibermanhttp://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,1089573,00.htmlMy Date with DrewSeptember 7, 2008August 3, 2005Entertainment WeeklyOn February 3, 2004, she received a star on theHollywood Walk of Fame.cite webhttp://www.rte.ie/arts/2004/0204/barrymored.htmlBarrymore gets star on Walk of FameSeptember 7, 2008February 4, 2004RTÃ‰

File:Drew Barrymore Whip it TIFF09 (cropped).jpgrightthumbuprightBarrymore signing autographsBarrymore's films compiled a worldwide box office gross that stood at over US$2.3 billion. According toThe Hollywood Reporter's annual Star Salary Top 10, she was tied for eighth place on the top ten list of actresses' salaries, commanding 10 to 12 million dollars per movie for 2006.cite newshttp://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/22040384/Witherspoon Hollywood's top-paid actressSeptember 9, 2008November 30, 2007[[MSNBC]]Associated PressBarrymore became the youngest person to have hostedSaturday Night Live(SNL) having hosted on November 20, 1982 at 7 years of age, a record that remained unbroken as of 2015.cite webhttp://www.people.com/people/drew_barrymoreDrew BarrymoreJuly 3, 2008[[People (American magazine)|People]]cite webhttp://www.nbc.com/Saturday_Night_Live/exclusives/backstage/green_room/key_hosts_barrymore.shtmlSaturday Night Live Backstage â€“ Green Room â€“ Key HostsJuly 25, 2008[[NBC]]http://web.archive.org/web/20080423053642/http://www.nbc.com/Saturday_Night_Live/exclusives/backstage/green_room/key_hosts_barrymore.shtmlApril 23, 2008yesOn February 3, 2007, Barrymore hosted SNL for the fifth time,making her the second female host (afterCandice Bergen) in the show's history to do so. She hosted again on October 10, 2009, becoming the first female to host six times. In March 2012, Barrymore began co-hosting the twelfth season ofThe Essentials (TCM)The Essentials,a film showcase onTurner Classic Movieswhich spotlighted significant classic films.cite webDrew Barrymore to Co-Host 12th Season of The Essentialshttp://www.tcm.com/this-month/movie-news.html?idMovie NewsTurner Entertainment Networks, Inc.February 14, 2012She so hosted alongside TCM regular,Robert Osborne.

Barrymore became aCoverGirlCosmetics's model and spokeswoman in 2007.cite newsSamanthaCritchellDrew Barrymore Is Newest Covergirl Modelhttp://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/04/11/AR2007041101230_pf.htmlSeptember 7, 2008April 11, 2007Washington PostIn February 2015, she remained one of the faces of CoverGirl, alongside Queen Latifah and Taylor Swift. The company partnered up with her, because "she emulates the iconic image of CoverGirl with her fresh, natural beauty and energetic yet authentic spirit," said Esi Eggleston Bracey, Vice President and General Manager of CoverGirl Cosmetics North America. She brought not only her personality into this endorsement but also her creative side, as she also helped create the ads.Fashion sectionBarrymore web siteShe was No. 1 inPeople (American magazine)People'sannual 100 Most Beautiful People list in 2007.cite webhttp://www.people.com/people/package/0,,20034523,00.htmlMost Beautiful People 2007September 7, 2008[[People (American magazine)|People]]Also in 2007, she was named the new face for theGuccijewelry line.cite newsRuthLa Ferlahttp://www.nytimes.com/2008/03/09/fashion/09magazines.html?nA Glossy Rehab for Tattered CareersJuly 20, 2008March 9, 2008[[The New York Times|New York Times]]cite webDrew Barrymore Goes Blinghttp://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2007/07/05/drew-barrymore-goes-bling/September 7, 2008July 5, 2007MTVAs a model, Barrymore signed a contract withIMG ModelsNew York City.

In May 2007, Barrymore was named Ambassador Against Hunger for the United NationsWorld Food Programmecite newsActress Drew Barrymore becomes advocate for UN World Food Programmehttp://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsIDMay 9, 2007May 15, 2007UN News Centrecite newshttp://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/05/11/AR2007051101280.htmlDrew Barrymore Becomes WFP AmbassadorSeptember 7, 2008May 11, 2007FOX Newsand later donated $1 million to the cause.cite newshttp://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsIDActress Drew Barrymore donates $1 million to UN anti-hunger programmeMarch 3, 2008March 19, 2008UN News CentreIn September 2010, Barrymore was confirmed to act out the role of Ganga in theCinema of IndiaIndianBollywoodfilmThe Lifestyle  In Generation Next,to be directed by Santosh Kumar Jain and released in 2012.update inlineSeptember 2013cite newshttp://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hollywood/news-interviews/Drew-Barrymore-to-play-Ganga/articleshow/6600068.cmsPiyali DasguptaDrew Barrymore to play GangaSeptember 21, 2010September 21, 2010Times of IndiaIndiaSeveral articles and interviews reported Barrymore's taste for photography. As a guest photographer for aTime Out (magazine)magazineseries called "They Shoot New York," she appeared on the cover holding aPentax K1000film camera.cite webhttp://newyork.timeout.com/articles/nyc-in-pictures/78131/they-shoot-new-york?newyork.timeout.comhttp://web.archive.org/web/20100911045303/http://newyork.timeout.com/articles/nyc-in-pictures/78131/they-shoot-new-york11 September 2010yesShe expressed hopes of exposing her work in a gallery one day, as she had documented the most recent decade of her life with a Pentax camera.cite journalhttp://www.elle.fr/elle/People/La-vie-des-people/Interviews/Drew-Barrymore-Les-amours-a-distance-c-est-l-histoire-de-ma-vie-!/Mon-Pentax/(gid)/1313916Drew Barrymore: Les amours Ã distance c'est l'histoire de ma vie !August 19, 2010[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]November 26, 2010fr
article.heading: Personal life
article.paragraph: File:Anne Helm John Drew Barrymore 1964.JPGrightthumbuprightFatherJohn Drew BarrymoreandAnne Helmin ''Gunsmoke'' (1964)In 2013, Barrymore stated during an appearance on talk showThe View (U.S. TV series)The Viewthat she enjoys practicing her husband's religion,Judaism, and is thinking of converting. "It's a beautiful faith and I'm so honored to be around it. It's so family-oriented [and] the stories are so beautiful and it's incredibly enlightening. I'm really happy."cite webShavivMiriamhttp://www.timesofisrael.com/shiksa-under-a-chuppa/Times of Israel. January 2013Timesofisrael.comJanuary 29, 2013November 2, 2013

Concerning her sexuality, in an interview withContact Musicin 2003, Barrymore said "Do I like women sexually? Yeah, I do. Totally. I have always considered myself bisexual."cite webhttp://www.webcitation.org/6DzSSMCJiDrew Barrymore: 'I Am Bisexual'Webcitation.orgNovember 2, 2013Barrymore was quoted in 2004 as saying, "A woman and a woman together are beautiful, just as a man and a woman together are beautiful. Being with a woman is like exploring your own body, but through someone else. When I was younger I used to go with lots of women. Totally. I love it".cite newsSophieRadicehttp://www.guardian.co.uk/theobserver/2004/may/09/featuresreview.reviewWhen hello really means bi for nowSeptember 7, 2008May 9, 2004The GuardianUKIn March 2007, former magazine editorJane Prattclaimed on herSirius Satellite Radioshow that she had a romance with Barrymore in the mid-1990s.cite webKeith J.Kellyhttp://www.nypost.com/seven/03282007/business/bosom_buddies_business_keith_j__kelly.htmBosom Buddies â€“ Pratt hit Sirius Airwaves, drops BombshellSeptember 7, 2008March 28, 2007[[New York Post]]

Barrymore is the godmother ofKurt CobainandCourtney Love's daughter,Frances Bean Cobain.cite webGilKaufmanhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1671281/cobain-frances-bean-pictures.jhtmlNirvana Heiress Frances Bean Cobain: About A GirlOctober 2, 2012September 23, 2011MTV

Barrymore has spoken of how she has grown much more conservative, since the birth of her children.http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/hollywood/i-am-more-conservative-as-mother-drew-barrymore/
article.heading: Relationships, marriages and family life
article.paragraph: In 1991, at the age of 16, Barrymore became engaged to Leland Hayward, grandson of Hollywood producerLeland Haywardwho was his namesake.cite journalElizabethSporkinThey'll Take Romancehttp://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20114525,00.htmlFebruary 25, 1991[[People (American magazine)|People]]357After a few months, this engagement was called off.cite journalTobyKahnhttp://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20108608,00.htmlPassagesSeptember 14, 1992[[People (American magazine)|People]]3811Barrymore was engaged to and lived with musician and actorJamie Waltersfrom 1992 to 1993.cite newsBarrymore takes 'Control' of Fisher rolehttp://www.variety.com/article/VR1117862063.html?categoryidJanuary 15, 2009VarietyArmyArcherdNovember 12, 1992
Barrymore married her first husband, Welsh bartender turned Los Angeles bar owner Jeremy Thomas, at the age of nineteen on March 20, 1994. She filed for divorce from him less than two months later.

Barrymore began dating MTV host and comedianTom Greenin 1999. Barrymore and Green lived together for a year before getting engaged in July 2000. They wed in July 2001.Green filed for divorce in December 2001.The divorce was finalized on October 15, 2002. Before their divorce, they starred together inCharlie's Angelsand Green's first directorial movieFreddy Got Fingered.cite webJeanneDarsthttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,26334,623114,00.htmlTom Green Files for a Divorce from DrewSeptember 7, 2008December 18, 2001[[People (American magazine)|People]]cite webStephen M.Silvermanhttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,26334,622131,00.htmlOops! Barrymore, Green Do It AgainSeptember 7, 2008July 10, 2001[[People (American magazine)|People]]

In 2002, Barrymore began datingThe Strokes' drummerFabrizio Moretti, soon after they met at a concert.Their five-year relationship ended in January 2007.cite webNicholasWhitehttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20011173,00.htmlDrew Barrymore Says She's Loving Single LifeSeptember 7, 2008February 8, 2007[[People (American magazine)|People]]She then began dating actorJustin Long,cite webJustin Long Takes Drew Barrymore Home to Meet the Parentshttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20162631,00.htmlSeptember 7, 2008November 28, 2007[[People (American magazine)|People]]but they confirmed they broke up in July 2008.cite webDrew Barrymore and Justin Long end relationshiphttp://www.foxnews.com/wires/2008Jul08/0,4670,PeopleBarrymoreLong,00.htmlSeptember 9, 2008July 8, 2008[[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox News.com]]Barrymore and Long reunited in 2009 and co-starred in the 2010 filmGoing the Distance (2010 film)Going the Distance, but reportedly broke up again in 2010.cite webDrew Barrymore, Justin Long Back Together ... for a Moviehttp://www.usmagazine.com/news/drew-barrymore-justin-long-back-together-for-a-movie-2009313March 31, 2009March 31, 2009[[Us Weekly]]http://web.archive.org/web/20090505072944/http://www.usmagazine.com/news/drew-barrymore-justin-long-back-together-for-a-movie-2009313May 5, 2009

In early 2011, Barrymore began dating art consultant Will Kopelman, the son of formerChanelCEO Arie Kopelman.cite webDrew Barrymore Spotted with a New Guyhttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20468634,00.htmlDecember 5, 2012February 24, 2011[[People (American magazine)|People]]The couple announced their engagement in January 2012,cite webDrew Barrymore Engaged to Will Kopelmanhttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20548489,00.htmlJanuary 5, 2012January 5, 2012[[People (American magazine)|People]]LizRafteryElizabethMcNeilcite webDrew Barrymore & Will Kopelman Share Engagement Photohttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20559194,00.htmlJanuary 5, 2012January 5, 2012[[People (American magazine)|People]]SarahMichaudand married on June 2, 2012 inMontecito, California.cite webDrew Barrymore Weds Will Kopelmanhttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20599594,00.htmlJune 2, 2012June 2, 2012[[People (American magazine)|People]]MichelleTauberThe couple's wedding picture was featured on the cover ofPeople (American magazine)Peoplemagazine on June 6, 2012.cite newsTriggsCharlotteDrew Barrymore Gushes About Her 'Perfect' Wedding Dayhttp://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20601489,00.htmlJune 7, 2012PeopleJune 6, 2012Barrymore and Kopelman have two daughters: Olive Barrymore Kopelman (born September 26, 2012)cite newsDrew Barrymore Welcomes Daughter Olivehttp://celebritybabies.people.com/2012/10/01/drew-barrymore-will-kopelman-welcome-daughter-olive/October 1, 2012[[People (American magazine)|People]]October 1, 2012and Frankie Barrymore Kopelman (born April 22, 2014).cite newsLeonAnyaJordanJulieDrew Barrymore Welcomes Daughter Frankiehttp://celebritybabies.people.com/2014/04/22/drew-barrymore-welcomes-daughter-frankie/April 22, 2014PeopleApril 22, 2014
